job_qualification: ['7 years', 'Management', 'Kanban', "Bachelor's degree", 'Scrum', 'Software development', 'APIs', 'Agile', 'Communication skills']
job_description: ['Eaton’s Corporate Sector division is currently seeking a Scrum Master.', 'The expected annual salary range for this role is $116250.03 - $170500.04 a year.', 'Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.', 'What you’ll do:', '', 'Eaton Corporation is currently seeking an experienced Scrum Master for our Time and Attendance Products to join our Information Technology team. This role can reside in any North American Eaton facility . This position will oversee and manage the product and software development teams as a servant leader.', 'The Scrum Master will ensure that teams follow Agile practices and Scrum framework values, work to increase team efficiency, and provide motivation and guidance for process improvement. The Scrum Master will ensure that all Scrum events take place and are positive, productive, and kept within the timebox. The Scrum Master will work eliminate team impediments. The Scrum Master works directly with Product Owners, engineers and other product team members to execute the product roadmap, guide the product development lifecycle, help create user stories, and manage the product backlog.', 'In this role:', 'Accountable for all Agile ceremonies of a Scrum team including planning, review, retrospectives, amd daily stand-ups', 'Drive a Secure Product Development Lifecycle approach that establishes a strong cybersecurity focus and culture across the entire engineering lifecycle', 'Trains, mentors, and supports Scrum teams to follow Agile values, principles, and practices', 'Use Agile methodology values, principles, and practices to plan, manage, and deliver solutions', 'Assists the Product Owner with roadmapping, epic creation and decomposition, and multi-sprint planning', 'Support the estimation and prioritization of user stories', 'Collect, track, and report Agile metrics on performance and progress', 'Support the identification and implementation of improvement opportunities', 'Support the resolution of impediments and escalate where required', 'Coordinate with other Agile teams to ensure alignment and management of dependencies including participation in Scrum of Scrums or related ceremonies where applicable', 'Ensures a safe and trusting environment for the team to raise and resolve issues', 'Leads the capacity planning for each sprint', 'Communicates risks, status and general updates to stakeholders', 'Manage one or more Scrum teams across multiple geographies', 'Improve the Agile maturity of the team on a continuous basis', 'Support the Product Owner in cost tracking for scrum projects', 'Qualifications:', '', 'Basic Qualifications:', '', "Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution", '7+ years of experience as a Scrum Master or in a similar role leading highly complex technology projects and programs.', 'No relocation is offered for this position. All candidates must currently reside within 50 miles of an Eaton facility to be considered.', 'Must be authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future', "This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.", 'Preferred Qualifications:', '', 'Experience working with Agile, including Scrum or Kanban', 'Experience with Agile software tools and producing Agile artifacts', 'General understanding of DevSecOps principles', 'General familiarity with modern software development principles including code management, test automation, APIs, microservices, and cloud services.', 'HR, Payroll and/or Workforce Management domain knowledge', 'Skills:', '', 'Strong communication and presentation skills', 'Patience and empathy working with mentees and people new to Agile', 'Comfortable working directly with both technical and non-technical audiences', 'Effective listening skills with the intention of understanding', 'Experience working with diverse, global cultures, organizations, and teams', "We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.", 'Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.', 'We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. Eaton provides various Health and Welfare benefits as well as Retirement benefits, and several programs that provide for paid and unpaid time away from work. Click here for more detail: Eaton Benefits Overview. Please note that specific programs and options available to an employee may depend on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.']

job_qualification: ['Google Suite', 'Writing skills', 'Engineering', 'English', '3 years', 'MRP', 'High school diploma or GED', 'Assembly', "Bachelor's degree", 'Organizational skills', 'Computer skills', "Associate's degree", 'Communication skills']
job_description: ['Are you an impatient person but reasonably proactive once you are an expert in a subject matter? Are you driven to be accurate and will correct others on “how it should be” if they are remotely off in their comments? When given new areas to research, do you become restless in the pursuit of factual information? Are you so skeptical that you have to be shown the resource to find it believable? Do others become frustrated with you because of your “prove it” mindset? Is your communication style more informative and factual than social? Do you have a fear of failing or being wrong? Is it easier to be safe than sorry for you? Do you like being the resident expert in matters that you are very familiar with? Do you feel like you would rather just do things yourself because no one can do it better than you?', '', '', 'If this sounds like you, then we need to talk…', '', '', 'Frazer, a leading builder of emergency medical vehicles, is currently seeking a', 'Drafter', 'to join our team. The', 'Drafter', 'at Frazer reports to the', 'Engineering Manager', ', and is responsible for providing technical design and documentation expertise to the engineering team. Responsible for creating engineering designs, drawings, and other technical information for use in manufacturing and fabrication of complex machine designs. Applies machine design principles and provides associated subject matter expertise to component integration, assembly buildup, manufacturing process selection, and hands-on problem solving. Supports the documentation and technical communication needs on a day-to-day basis and for select projects.', '', '', 'What Does a Week in the Life of the Drafter Look Like?', '', 'Create and modify designs from preliminary sketches, verify that documents meet required specifications, and create technical reports. Create preliminary design sketches for conceptual analysis.', 'Using computer-aided design (CAD) and professional office software, create technical documents to support the design and assembly products or structures. Create engineering drawings and designs for production and manufacturing.', 'Using ERP applications, specify technical data required to populate and enable the MRP system. Create design specifications, documentation, and material lists.', 'Support the Production department by providing input to determine technical requirements or to address day-to-day inquiries. Prepare complete documentation packages for internal customers.', 'Partner with Purchasing to specify item requirements for new and legacy components and assemblies. Estimate material and production costs for designs.', 'Complete work improvement projects promptly by guiding operators and supervisors.', 'Document and maintain operations guidelines, including policies, procedures, and work instructions', 'Perform other related duties and responsibilities as required.', 'Essential duties listed above are performed while encouraging a Safety First atmosphere and supporting safety initiatives at our Facility.', '', '', 'Secondary Duties:', '', 'Support designated projects and improvement initiatives.', 'Participate in daily staff meetings', 'Required Education and Experience:', '', 'High school diploma.', 'Associate’s Degree in engineering technology or related technical field', 'Ability to operate Inventor computer-aided design (CAD) software and manual drafting workstations. Ability to operate within an Inventor Vault environment.', '3 years or more experience working with engineering professionals – engineers, technicians, drafters.', 'Ability to collaborate with other engineering disciplines – electrical, structural, automotive, and certification.', 'Ability to work in a process driven environment – quality, supply chain, production, and engineering.', 'Knowledge of Manufacturing Methods and Procedures, Manufacturing Quality, ERP System Utilization, Developing Standards, Information Analysis.', 'Exceptional attention to detail and a high level of accuracy', 'Communication skills with an emphasis on reading and writing for creating documentation and reports', '', '', 'Preferred Education and Experience:', '', 'Bachelor’s Degree in engineering technology or related technical field', '', '', "What's it like to be a part of the Frazer Family?", '', "Frazer is a fast-paced company that is creating some of the most innovative vehicles in the world. You'll find a unique team of individuals who continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in the Healthcare and EMS space. A diverse team, a great culture, and a positive work environment are just some of the things that make working at Frazer so rewarding.", '', '', 'What Kind of Employees Thrive at Frazer?', '', 'Frazer is a company with a diverse group of employees from all over the world. Frazer welcomes employees with all types of backgrounds, cultural and socio-economic backgrounds. If you are hard working, honest and drug-free, you will love working at Frazer.', '', '', 'Safety & Drug Policy', '', "Employee health and safety is a priority here at Frazer. We're committed to providing a safe, secure and productive environment for our Frazer family.", '', '', 'To help with this, we perform thorough background checks during the hiring process for all candidates. Convictions will not disqualify you from employment at Frazer, but failure to tell us about it up front will. Also, Frazer has a zero tolerance drug use policy and you must pass a pre-employment drug screen. If you can’t pass it, we’re not the place for you.', '', '', 'A True Culture', '', 'Frazer is a company that relies on its core values and the drive of its people. With a focus on longevity and employee success, Frazer welcomes its employees to push the envelope and drive improvement across all aspects of the company. At Frazer, you can unleash your potential!', '', '', 'Employee Driven Benefits', '', "At Frazer, we take pride in listening to what our employees want in benefits. We've come up with a unique set of employee benefits and designed them around our culture.", '', '', 'Weekly paycheck, so you can shop every Friday!', 'Health Care Insurance', 'Dental Benefit options', '401k plan with a company match!', 'Disability Insurance', 'Paid Time Off that begins accruing your first day of employment', 'Eight paid company holidays and ability to take time off during company shut down from Christmas to New Year’s Day!', 'The “Company Kitchen” on site for lunch and snack choices', 'Flexible Work Schedules', 'Professional development and skills training', 'Free Life Skills Training such as financial wellness classes', '', '', 'How Performance is Evaluated', '', 'Communication and collaboration are key at Frazer and we encourage an environment filled with positive feedback and constructive criticism, to unleash your potential for real professional growth! We use things like self-evaluations, group reviews, and quarterly check-ins to help define a clear path to success. You will also have an opportunity to give feedback to peers to help them to grow in their roles as well.', 'Skills (to Pay the Bills)', '', "Here's a list of a few competencies that the", 'Drafter', 'at Frazer should have…', '', '', 'Demonstrates independent judgment and well-developed emotional intelligence.', 'Possesses strong organizational skills; able to prioritize tasks.', 'Ability to develop productive working relationships with personnel at all levels of the organization.', 'Handles confidential information appropriately; uses tact and diplomacy.', 'Demonstrates excellent attention to detail and a customer-service mindset.', 'Possesses proactive problem-solving skills; suggests solutions.', 'Is committed to superior performance; meets deadlines.', 'Handles pressure and works well in a fast-paced environment.', 'Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, where change happens often and without prior notice.', 'A self-disciplined person with precise accuracy for details.', 'Ethical and trustworthy conduct and adherence to policies and procedures.', '', '', 'Software Knowledge', '', 'Also, here are a few software packages that the', 'Drafter', 'would eventually need to be versed in. Don’t worry . . . we expect some on-the-job training.', '', '', 'Google G-Suite (Gmail, Documents, Drive, Spreadsheets, etc.)', 'UKG (HRIS)', '', '', 'Oh, and $alary', '', "Of course, we didn't forget salary… Frazer offers competitive pay and this role will start with a salary between $26.00 to $34.00 per hour depending on education, certifications, and experience.", '', '', 'Work Schedule', '', 'The', 'Drafter', 'will work', 'Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM-3:30 PM', '. Late afternoon/evening/weekend hours may be required as needed. Work schedules may change to accommodate production needs.', '', '', 'Application Process', '', 'If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, visit our website to complete the following steps:', '', 'Online application', 'Resume and optional cover letter', 'Culture Index Survey - as part of our process, please take this short survey (5-12 minutes to complete) on a computer, tablet, or laptop NOT a smart phone. It does not always function properly on smart phones and is difficult to see. Also, please take the survey in your native/first language (there are multiple choices besides English in the drop down menu if needed).', '', 'Culture Index Survey Link', '', 'Thanks again for your interest in Frazer. Should your skills and qualifications meet those of the position, we will contact you further. Please check your email for further application status updates.', '', 'We look forward to hearing from you!']

job_qualification: ['Project engineering', 'Software troubleshooting', 'Programmable logic controllers', "Bachelor's degree", 'Electrical Engineering']
job_description: ['JOB SUMMARY', 'Successful candidate will operate as a multifunctional engineer with substantial latitude for action and serve as an advisor for the BOP software team. Responsibilities include providing guidance on software design, implementation and validation; Recommend improvements/changes to the design and changes in processes and procedures as needed. Support the upgrades and new build software engineering teams on aftermarket/customer orders when needed. This includes generating the necessary software documentation to ensure proper QA from the engineering phase to installation & commissioning.', 'Primary Responsibilities:', 'Design, write and configure software (PLC, HMI, industrial networking devices) for BOP control system applications.', 'Assist in the development and maintenance of commissioning and software documentation including updates after release.', 'Provide support for the implementation, training and troubleshooting of software products.', 'Develop and de-bug software products prior to release.', 'Diagnose and troubleshoot associated hardware as required.', 'Perform other work-related tasks as assigned.', 'Comply with all NOV Company and HSE policies and procedures.', 'Follow NOV processes to execute projects.', 'Work with customers (internal/external) and review project defining documents to understand project requirements.', 'Participate in design reviews.', 'Develop Software Design Specification for NOV BOP control system in collaboration with other engineering teams and customer.', 'Write logic for PLC software used to monitor and control a BOP and its auxiliary systems.', 'Design and program an HMI Application used on a BOP and its auxiliary systems.', 'Perform internal test and customer FAT of BOP control system software.', 'Troubleshoot and Debug software and provide remote field support when needed.', 'Qualifications:', 'Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering.', 'Location: 6390 N Eldridge Pkwy., Houston TX 77041.', 'Hybrid schedule (3 days in the office and 2 days remote work) after completion of training.', "Preferred 5 or more years' experience designing control systems and programming PLCs/HMIs.", 'Preferred 5 or more years of Project Engineering experience.']

job_qualification: ['Mechanical design', '5 years', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'GD&T', 'Product development', 'SolidWorks', 'Design controls', 'Root cause analysis', 'Medical imaging', 'Plastics injection molding']
job_description: ['Argon Medical Devices is a global manufacturer of specialty medical products, headquartered in Plano, Texas. Argon offers a broad line of medical devices for Interventional Radiology, Vascular Surgery, Interventional Cardiology and Oncology. Argon’s brand is recognized for best-in-class products that improve patient outcomes via percutaneous, image-guided procedures. Our values describe what we believe in and how we operate. These values are our moral compass which guide our decisions and define the deeply held beliefs and principles of our organizational culture. Argon Medical is a family of individuals united by a mission and culture which continue to grow stronger every day.', 'Outstanding opportunity for a Senior Design & Development Engineer to join our team at our Headquarters in Plano, TX!', 'What you will do:', 'The', 'Senior Design & Development Engineer', 'performs and owns all aspects of new and existing medical device product design, drawing, development, costing, manufacturability, optimization, Engineering confidence testing, packaging, and design control documentation with adherence to all applicable standards from conception to launch.', 'Establishes requirements and assures product conformance through appropriate inspection and test activities.', 'Review product / system requirements and create new concepts for mechanical design of new product or enhance the design of existing product as required and own the development process from concept to launch.', 'Develop mechanical design to product specifications in compliance with company standards, procedures, specifications, and codes.', 'Design and develop tolerance stack analysis using 3D modeling and statistical tools. Support the design control process with necessary documentation like DFMEA, Impact analysis.', 'Prepares layout and detailed drawings including all required fits, dimensions, section views and parts lists/BOM', 'Conduct complex FEA, as needed, to ascertain the design conforms to the functional and safety requirements.', 'Conduct complex DFMEA and develop design controls to mitigate the product level risk.', 'Investigate new materials and incorporate complex DFM and DFA principles into product design', 'Perform mold flow analysis to ascertain the part design accommodates all injection molding process requirements.', 'Lead design reviews for systems robustness and Design for Manufacture and Assembly (DFMA)', 'Perform root cause analysis to resolve design anomalies and incorporate design changes as necessary', 'Work with external vendors to build prototypes and evaluate performance. Perform ECT testing together with the V&V team, guide the test team as an SME', 'Skills for Success:', 'BSME with 5+ years of medical device mechanical design engineering and product development experience.', 'Experience in interventional radiology product a plus', 'SolidWorks and FEA. Mold flow analysis is an advantage', 'GD & T, Detailed drawings, Tolerance analysis', 'Ability to implement DFM and DFA principles into product design and conduct risk analysis', 'Knowledge of standard laboratory test methods for mechanical functional parameters', 'Ability to perform root cause analysis using both experimental and statistical analyses', 'Knowledge of plastics and injection molding', 'Argon Medical is an equal opportunity employer and complies with anti-discrimination laws. We believe that inclusion and diversity fosters creativity, innovation, and empowers all our employees which makes us a stronger organization overall. We promote a culture that maintains a balanced and diverse workforce.', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Pay: $72,138.27 - $140,000.00 per year', 'Benefits:', '401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Employee assistance program', 'Flexible spending account', 'Health insurance', 'Health savings account', 'Life insurance', 'Paid time off', 'Tuition reimbursement', 'Vision insurance', 'Schedule:', '8 hour shift', 'Ability to commute/relocate:', 'Plano, TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)', 'Application Question(s):', 'Do you have at least 5 years of experience designing medical devices?', 'Work Location: In person']

job_description: ['Position Summary:', 'To provide lead service support to Cat Lift Trucks, Mitsubishi Forklift Trucks, Jungheinrich and UniCarriers Forklifts. Position requires extensive contact with dealers and customers. Position may require up to 15% travel. Position is responsible for monitoring product health by identifying, quantifying, investigating, and analyzing quality and reliability problems being experienced by Logisnext product in the field. Position assists in coordinating with other departments to resolve problems and communicate solutions to the field. Position is instrumental in helping to control and reduce warranty costs. Mentors Service Analysts.', 'Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Qualifications or Credentials:', 'High School / GED', '5 -7 years job related experience', '3+ years lift truck industry experience.', 'Ability to travel to customer sites.', 'Dealer contact experience.', 'Interpretation of Engineering drawings / drafting.', 'Failure analysis experience.', 'Microsoft Office experience.', 'Statistical analysis skills.', 'Work Environment and Physical Demands:', 'Work in an office helping dealers & MLA manufacturing troubleshoot product issues UCA, Cat, Mit IC model forklifts. Office & field work visiting dealers.', 'Work Hours and Expected Travel:', 'Up to 10% Travel.', 'Standard business hours.', 'Desired Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Credentials or Education:', 'Bachelor’s Degree: Engineering', 'Education may substitute for experience.', 'Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned, at any time with or without notice.', 'This company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status.', 'Mitsubishi Logisnext Americas Group (Logisnext) does not accept unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. job_description: ['Position:', 'Electrical Engineer', 'Location:', 'Rosharon TX', 'Full Time', 'The Electrical Engineer as part of the Incubation Hub team is responsible for the electrical architecture of the multiple projects part of the Incubation Hub to meet the project requirements. This involves the system and board level architecture as well as the development (design & test) of analogic, digital, and power supply of systems operating on batteries. The Electrical Engineer also assists in working with external companies to outsource part of the deliverables.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Assist in identifying and organizing requirements.', 'Derive from requirements architecture for system and board level.', 'Analysis and simulations of the various architectures to extract key design choices.', 'Produce analyses and mathematical models and draw design conclusions based on those.', 'Power source selection (batterie, supercapacitors)', 'Ability to select components based on analysis of specifications and reliability.', 'Conduct Failure Analysis at board, tool, and system level.', 'Design proof of concept', 'Author technical reports, papers, articles, patents, and presentations. job_description: ['Owning your career with TI', 'At TI we encourage you to take full ownership of your career journey. This approach is intentional, as you are the only one that can identify the type of career you want. Most big decisions in life require a plan, your career is no different. Developing a career plan can help you determine which way, or combination of ways, you want to grow your career. Maybe you want to progress higher in your organization, or develop a deeper expertise in a specific area, or maybe you prefer to gain broader experience in a variety of areas. Whatever it is, our approach enables you to design your path. To learn more about owning your career, check out our internal myCareer resource page.', "We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it.", 'Do you want to work for an organization that values your opinion? Do you want to work for an organization where you can play a pivotal role in several different areas? Look no further. As a Texas Instruments Equipment Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work in a vibrant and dynamic team oriented environment.', '', '', 'Responsibilities include:', '', 'Evaluating, selecting, and ordering equipment that is most appropriate and cost effective for the manufacture of company products', '', 'Overseeing the installation, modification, upgrade and maintenance of manufacturing equipment', '', "Keeping current on equipment manufacturers' technical notices, upgrades and safety issues", '', 'Studying equipment performance and reliability', '', 'Establishing programs and solutions for increasing uptime and for equipment problems that affect the manufacturing process', '', 'Providing technical support to the manufacturing equipment repair and process engineering organizations', '', 'Defining and writing preventative maintenance schedules', 'Minimum Requirements:', "Minimum Education (Bachelor's degree Electrical Engineering, Electrical Computer Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science Engineering,) Physics or related engineering degree", 'Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience working in a semiconductor manufacturing environment as an Equipment Engineer', 'Preferred Qualifications:', 'Equipment experience with AMAT and/or Axcelis Implanters', 'Prior experience with high vacuum and/or ultra high vacuum systems', 'Equipment experience on other equipment (e.g., AMAT, Veeco, TEL, Novellus, and/or ASM)', 'Experience on tool monitoring and interdiction software, and equipment maintenance and documentation', 'Working knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing, and SPC techniques. Experienced with semiconductor cleanroom protocol and behaviors.', 'Strong verbal and written communication skills', 'Demonstrated strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills', 'Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions', 'Ability to take the initiative and drive for results', 'Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery', 'Ability to work effectively in an interrupt-driven, fast-paced and rapidly changing environment', 'Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationship', '', '', 'Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, genetic information, national origin, gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.', '', '', 'If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.']

job_description: ['Swan Products, LLC is a leading manufacturer of lawn and garden watering products in North America. As a privately held company, we retain our position in the market with strategically placed manufacturing and distribution facilities throughout the United States and Canada.', 'Job Summary', 'The Manufacturing Process Engineer designs and implements systems and equipment procedures used in our manufacturing facility. The main duties include testing and monitoring equipment, updating current system processes and conducting risk assessments.', 'Primary Functions and Duties', 'Manage projects/coordinate equipment installation and layout/implement process and flow changes by working directly with involved supervisory and floor personnel', 'Discover opportunities for waste reduction and capacity improvement and proactively drive solutions with and without capital investment', 'Discover opportunities to improve Operational KPI through methods analysis, observation, time study etc.)', 'Facilitate kaizen events targeting key improvements to drive productivity, data management/collection, and paperwork handling improvements', 'Analyze monthly financial performance to identify and improve operational metrics including adhering to product quality specifications, material usage, reduction in product returns etc.', 'Qualifications', 'Bachelors degree in mechanical/chemical engineering or a similar field, job_description: ['Job Summary:', 'As an integral member of the New Product Development/ packaging team this position is responsible to provide technical expertise in the use, and selection of packaging components. The Packaging engineer will use their engineering expertise to understand and resolve quality related issues associated with component packaging in consumer products or package testing industry. An ideal candidate will also have related experience and expertise in the injection and blow molding manufacturing environment. The packaging engineer will use their project management and manufacturing skills to lead projects associated with product packing design and issue resolution. This role will be familiar with and may personally conduct testing required to ensure our packaging meets internal and external quality standards. The Packaging engineer will support the NPD, Manufacturing, and Quality teams as needed both in the selection of appropriate packaging, and in the resolution of packaging issues identified through the Igloo complaint & return process.', 'The role will act as either a key technical support person or technical lead for various quality projects and programs from concept through commercialization. The individual will be expected to accomplish objectives through their individual contributions as well as supporting others in the department or across platforms. If you are motivated by complex, purposeful challenges, the packaging engineer position at Igloo could be for you!', 'Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:', 'Manages new and existing product packaging testing to meet company objectives', 'Leads packaging related quality improvements to reduce internal and external occurring damages.', 'Test, analyze, and select material for packaging based on durability and cost effectiveness.', 'Consults with corrugate vendors in the development of packaging to ensure best practices are met.', 'Creates packaging SOP’s and Work Instructions. Provides training for appropriate plant personnel performing packaging activities.', 'Develops and executes test methods, validations, and protocols for packaging.', 'Works directly with key functions such as Quality, Ecommerce, Engineering and Operations to design or redesign packaging through the use of appropriate software for structure analyses and logistics, optimizing packaging as it relates to product, pallet, storage, truck, container and customer requirements.', 'Support shopfloor with Visual Work Instructions for WIP part pack out and Finished Goods pallet stacking.', 'Administer and maintain the information loaded into the Oracle Item Master for shipping dimensions, item dimensions, cube, and weight.', 'Remains current on consumer product packaging innovations throughout the industry and proliferates leading technologies within the company.', 'Identify and implement packaging engineering savings (1.5 x annual salary).', 'Minimum Qualifications:', 'Education: Bachelor’s degree in Packaging Engineering or related field', 'Experience: Minimum 2 years packaging engineering role', 'English language skills: Able to read, write, speak, and comprehend English', 'Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to express one’s ideas and opinions with confidence', 'Highly organized and detail oriented', 'Self-starter who takes action and initiative', 'Preferred Qualifications:', 'Previous experience with CPG (Consumer packaged goods) company', 'and/or', 'Previous work experience with package testing labs', 'Familiar with mass retailer specifications and requirements', 'Can understand, speak, or write Spanish', 'Igloo’s Code of Coolness:', 'WE WIN AS A TEAM -', 'Each of us is an expert in our role and we work together to meet our goals. We value communication, honesty, and respect and operate with a high degree of integrity. Each one of us makes a difference every day.', 'WE HAVE FUN -', 'Coolers are a fun business. While we take our work seriously, we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We celebrate our successes as individuals and as a team.', 'WE FAIL FAST -', 'There are few decisions that any of us make that can’t be reversed. We take calculated risks and we hold ourselves accountable for the results. We change course when necessary and we learn from our mistakes. We win because we’re willing to fail.', 'WE’RE SCRAPPY -', 'We treat the business as if it were our own. We do more with less and we have a high sense of urgency to meet the needs of our consumers and customers.', 'WE HAVE A POSITIVE CAN-DO ATTITUDE -', 'We see opportunities where others see risk. We go above and beyond our role to get things done for our customers and our teammates.', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Pay: $75,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year', 'Benefits:', '401(k)', '401(k) matching', 'Dental insurance', 'Employee discount', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off', 'Referral program', 'Vision insurance', 'Experience level:', '2 years', 'Schedule:', '8 hour shift', 'Monday to Friday', 'Work setting:', 'In-person', 'Application Question(s):', 'What are your salary expectations?', 'Work Location: In person']

Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.', 'Please Note:', 'This posting is intended to collect candidate information for Halliburton’s talent pool, and is not considered an application. In addition to providing your information on this posting, we encourage you to create a Job Alert within our career site. The Job Alert allows you to select search criteria for positions that match your interest(s). Once positions are posted that match your search criteria, you will receive an email notification.', 'Location: Carrollton, TX', 'Halliburton has immediate opportunity for a Power Electronics Electrical Engineer located in Carrollton, TX. This is an exciting opportunity to join an innovative team at one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry. The ideal candidate will have Downhole Tool Design experience, specifically high temperature electronics.', '', 'Responsibilities:', 'Design, simulation, development, implementation, verification and validation of Analog and Power Electronics based systems & components used in downhole applications where the systems must withstand harsh environments and exhibit high reliability', 'Development of common AC/DC and DC/DC converter topologies & inverters for motor drives', 'Knowledge of power electronics converter systems including active/passive component selection, input/output filter design, compensation circuit design and gate driver circuits', 'Experience in design and specification of power electronic magnetics and motors', 'PCB design and layout', 'Troubleshooting of power electronics and proficiency in using lab equipment', 'Working knowledge in commonly used circuit simulators (LTSPICE, PSPICE, etc.) and math tools (Matlab, MathCAD, etc.)', 'Functional and qualification testing of the designed boards and sub-assemblies', 'Qualifications:', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field', 'Experience with Board Level Analog Design', 'Downhole Design experience', 'Experience with High Temperature Electronics', 'Experience with Power Electronics and Motor Drives', 'Note:', 'This is not a remote position but hybrid and will require onsite 2-3 days per week', 'Candidates having qualifications that exceed the minimum job requirements will receive consideration for higher level roles given (1) their experience, (2) additional job requirements, and/or (3) business needs. Depending on education, experience, and skill level, a variety of job opportunities might be available from the Power Electronics Electrical Engineer up to a Senior Power Electronics Electrical Engineer', 'Compensation Information', 'Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.', 'Location', '2550 Country Club Drive, Carrollton, Texas 75006', 'Job Details', 'Requisition Number:', '178154', '', 'Experience Level:', 'Experienced Hire', '', 'Job Family:', 'Engineering/Science/Technology', '', 'PSL:', 'Testing and Subsea', '', 'Full Time / Part Time:', 'Full Time', 'Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, citizenship, marital status, sex/gender, sexual preference/ orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, national origin, or any other status protected by law or regulation.']

job_description: ['Are you an impatient person but reasonably proactive once you are an expert in a subject matter? Are you driven to be accurate and will correct others on “how it should be” if they are remotely off in their comments? When given new areas to research, do you become restless in the pursuit of factual information? Are you so skeptical that you have to be shown the resource to find it believable? Do others become frustrated with you because of your “prove it” mindset? Is your communication style more informative and factual than social? Do you have a fear of failing or being wrong? Is it easier to be safe than sorry for you? Do you like being the resident expert in matters that you are very familiar with? Do you feel like you would rather just do things yourself because no one can do it better than you?', '', '', 'If this sounds like you, then we need to talk…', '', '', 'Frazer, a leading builder of emergency medical vehicles, is currently seeking a', 'Mechanical Engineer II, Certification', 'to join our team. The', 'Mechanical Engineer II, Certification', 'at Frazer reports to the', 'Engineering Manager', 'and is responsible for providing technical leadership to the engineering team. This position is responsible for championing the Frazer Certification & Standards Program, providing general and mechanical engineering subject matter expertise, requirements management, technical compliance assessments, and project planning with a focus on work breakdown structures and resource estimation. This position will serve as the subject matter expert for advancing, sustaining, and defending certification and standard compliance projects and initiatives across the Frazer product portfolio. This position will support engineering projects and initiatives, assist in specification development, and provide leadership and oversight support to the certification program.', '', '', 'What Does a Week in the Life of the Mechanical Engineer II, Certification Look Like?', '', 'Design, develop, and execute test and evaluation protocols for mechanical, electrical, structural, and automotive equipment, components, assemblies, or systems.', 'Apply mathematical and engineering principles and methods.', 'Perform extensive testing and evaluation of designs to ensure reliability, performance, and safety standards are achieved.', 'Conduct research and studies new technologies for new and legacy products.', 'Serve as project manager for the Frazer Certification & Standards Program.', 'Advise on system integration issues across vehicle platforms and products.', 'Advise disposition of new and non-conforming equipment items.', 'Coordinate with vendors, suppliers, and other third parties.', 'Complete work assignments promptly.', 'Document and maintain plans, reports, drawings, specifications, instructions, procedures, and guidelines.', 'Perform other related duties and responsibilities as required.', 'Essential duties listed above are performed while encouraging a Safety First atmosphere and supporting safety initiatives at our Facility', '', '', 'Secondary Duties:', '', 'Support designated projects and improvement initiatives.', 'Participate in engineering staff meetings', '', '', 'Required Education and Experience:', '', 'Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering', 'Experience working with engineering professionals – engineers, technicians, drafters.', 'Ability to collaborate with other engineering disciplines – mechanical, structural, automotive, and certification.', 'Ability to work in a process driven environment – quality, supply chain, production, and engineering.', 'Experience managing single and multi-phase projects.', 'Experience in the following engineering practices: estimation (time & cost), design and configuration development, bill of material development, manufacturing sequence development, systems design, sustainment and maintenance, and test and evaluation.', 'Experience working with ERP and MRP enterprise systems.', 'Experience creating, using, modifying, archiving technical documentation.', '2-4 years related experience', '', '', 'Preferred Education and Experience:', '', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related technical degree with 5+ years of experience showing progressing increases in technical responsibility.', 'Electrical Vehicle design and/or assembly certifications.', 'AutoCAD and Solidworks or Inventor skills', 'Conceptual knowledge of custom vehicle production experience', '', '', "What's it like to be a part of the Frazer Family?", '', "Frazer is a fast-paced company that is creating some of the most innovative vehicles in the world. You'll find a unique team of individuals who continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in the Healthcare and EMS space. A diverse team, a great culture, and a positive work environment are just some of the things that make working at Frazer so rewarding.", '', '', 'What Kind of Employees Thrive at Frazer?', '', 'Frazer is a company with a diverse group of employees from all over the world. Frazer welcomes employees with all types of backgrounds, cultural and socio-economic backgrounds. If you are hard working, honest and drug-free, you will love working at Frazer.', '', '', 'Safety & Drug Policy', '', "Employee health and safety is a priority here at Frazer. We're committed to providing a safe, secure and productive environment for our Frazer family.", '', '', 'To help with this, we perform thorough background checks during the hiring process for all candidates. Convictions will not disqualify you from employment at Frazer, but failure to tell us about it up front will. Also, Frazer has a zero tolerance drug use policy and you must pass a pre-employment drug screen. If you can’t pass it, we’re not the place for you.', '', '', 'A True Culture', '', 'Frazer is a company that relies on its core values and the drive of its people. With a focus on longevity and employee success, Frazer welcomes its employees to push the envelope and drive improvement across all aspects of the company. At Frazer, you can unleash your potential!', '', '', 'Employee Driven Benefits', '', 'At Frazer, we take pride in listening to what our employees want in benefits. With our "What You Want" committee, we\'ve come up with a unique set of employee benefits and designed them around our culture.', '', 'Weekly paycheck, so you can shop every Friday!', 'Health Care Insurance (100% paid for by the company for all employees)', 'Dental Benefit options', '401k plan with a company match!', 'Disability Insurance', 'Paid Time Off that begins accruing your first day of employment', 'Eight paid company holidays and ability to take time off during company shut down from Christmas to New Year’s Day!', 'The “Company Kitchen” on site for lunch and snack choices', 'Flexible Work Schedules', 'Professional development and skills training', 'Free Life Skills Training such as financial wellness classes', '', '', 'How Performance is Evaluated', '', 'Communication and collaboration are key at Frazer and we encourage an environment filled with positive feedback and constructive criticism, to unleash your potential for real professional growth! We use things like self-evaluations, group reviews, and quarterly check-ins to help define a clear path to success. You will also have an opportunity to give feedback to peers to help them to grow in their roles as well.', '', '', 'Skills (to Pay the Bills)', '', "Here's a list of a few competencies that the", 'Mechanical Engineer II, Certification', 'at Frazer should have…', '', 'Demonstrates independent judgment and well-developed emotional intelligence.', 'Possesses strong organizational skills; able to prioritize tasks.', 'Ability to develop productive working relationships with personnel at all levels of the organization.', 'Handles confidential information appropriately; uses tact and diplomacy.', 'Demonstrates excellent attention to detail and a customer-service mindset.', 'Possesses proactive problem-solving skills; suggests solutions.', 'Is committed to superior performance; meets deadlines.', 'Handles pressure and works well in a fast-paced environment.', 'Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, where change happens often and without prior notice.', 'A self-disciplined person with precise accuracy for details.', 'Ethical and trustworthy conduct and adherence to policies and procedures.', '', '', 'Software Knowledge', '', 'Also, here are a few software packages that the', 'Mechanical Engineer II, Certification', 'would eventually need to be versed in. Don’t worry . . . we expect some on-the-job training.', '', 'Google G-Suite (Gmail, Documents, Drive, Spreadsheets, etc.)', 'Kronos (HRIS)', 'ERP and MRP enterprise systems', '', '', 'Oh, and $alary', '', "Of course, we didn't forget salary… Frazer offers competitive pay and this role will start with a salary between $85,000-$97,000 annually depending on education, certifications, and experience.", '', '', 'Work Schedule', '', 'The', 'Mechanical Engineer II, Certification', 'will work', 'Monday-Friday 7:00 AM-3:30 PM.', '. Frazer currently runs two shifts, Monday through Friday with overtime on weekend work as needed. Late afternoon/evening/weekend hours may be required as needed. Work schedules may change to accommodate production needs.', '', '', 'Application Process', '', 'If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, visit our website to complete the following steps:', '', 'Online application', 'Resume and optional cover letter', 'Culture Index Survey - as part of our process, please take this short survey (5-12 minutes to complete) on a computer, tablet, or laptop NOT a smart phone. It does not always function properly on smart phones and is difficult to see. Also, please take the survey in your native/first language (there are multiple choices besides English in the drop down menu if needed).', '', 'Culture Index Survey Link', '', 'Thanks again for your interest in Frazer. Should your skills and qualifications meet those of the position, we will contact you further. Please check your email for further application status updates.', '', 'We look forward to hearing from you!']

methods.', 'Work to stay within project budgets and schedules.', 'Evaluate engineering, manufacturing, and business processes, making suggestions as appropriate to make', 'improvements.', 'Identify job_qualification: ['SAFe', 'Software Engineering', 'Kanban', '5 years', 'Project management', "Bachelor's degree", 'Continuous improvement', 'Mentoring', 'Computer Engineering', 'Scrum', 'Fine Arts', 'Business Administration', 'Communication skills']
job_description: ['Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life? At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative and collaborative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference. As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures. Join us and Apply today!', 'What you will be doing', 'Summary:', 'We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced SAFe Release Train Engineer (RTE) who will also serve as an Agile Coach to support our fast-paced organization. As the RTE, you will be a servant leader responsible for overseeing and coordinating the Agile release train. Your primary focus will be to facilitate the successful planning, execution, and delivery of our products and services, while also fostering agile mindset and practices within the organization.', 'Primary Duties and Key Responsibilities:', 'Release Train Management:', 'Coordinate the Agile release train (ART) consisting of multiple teams, ensuring alignment and collaboration across all teams (IT, Product and other business teams) towards efficient and effective value delivery', 'Drive the alignment, planning and delivery of our products and services within the train', 'Provide Agile leadership and guidance to the Agile teams, scrum masters and other team members', 'Foster a culture of collaboration, self-organization, and empowerment', 'Facilitation and Coordination:', 'Help the ART prepare for Program Increment (PI) Planning', 'Facilitate PI planning events, and other key ceremonies to ensure efficient and effective collaboration among teams', 'Coordinate dependencies and manage risks to ensure successful value delivery', 'Discern when to escalate risks and changes to the leadership team', 'Coaching the ART:', 'Serve as an Agile coach, guiding the ART in the adoption and implementation of Agile principles and practices', 'Coach Scrum Masters in ART team events and practices', 'Help teams identify and overcome challenges and promote a culture of continuous improvement', 'Metrics and Reporting:', 'Establish and maintain metrics and reporting mechanisms to provide visibility into the progress, quality, and health of the ART.', 'Regularly communicate key metrics and insights to stakeholders and leadership', 'Continuous improvement:', 'Drive relentless improvement initiatives within the ART, identifying areas for enhancement and implementing strategies to optimize processes, productivity, and overall agile team performance', 'Stakeholder Management:', 'Collaborate closely with product managers, scrum masters, the lead team, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment of priorities, requirements, and delivery timelines', 'Foster strong relationships and effective communication channels', 'SAFe Adoption:', 'Promote and facilitate the adoption of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) principles, values, and practices within the organization.', 'Train and mentor team members and stakeholders on SAFe concepts and methodologies.', 'What your background should look like', 'Bachelor’s degree in IT, Software Engineering, Business Administration or related field OR equivalent experience', '5+ years agile team facilitation experience', '10+ years total project management experience', 'Experience on multiple Scrum teams in a variety of different contexts (different team sizes, different organizations, different cultures, co-located vs. distributed, etc.)', 'Knowledge of development environments, platforms, and technologies', 'Well versed in a variety of agile approaches (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, Lean at a minimum)', 'Experience providing program, portfolio, and team level process, mentoring and coaching to senior leadership, portfolio managers and teams', 'Experience with ad-hoc coaching and mentoring techniques', 'Strong knowledge and experience of the SAFe framework and its core principles', 'Proven track record of serving as an Agile coach, guiding teams in adopting and implementing Agile principles', 'Excellent facilitation and coordination skills, the ability to manage multiple teams and stakeholders effectively', 'Strong problem-solving and decision -making abilities, with a focus on continuous improvement', 'Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels', 'Agile certifications such as SAFe RTE, SAFe Agilist, or similar certification are required', 'Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with tight deadlines and evolving priorities', 'What AmerisourceBergen offers', 'We offer a competitive total rewards package which includes benefits and compensation. Our commitment to our eligible population of team members includes benefit programs that are comprehensive, affordable, diverse, and designed to meet the needs of our team members’ and their families. Some of these programs include paid time off including paid parental leave, access to retirement savings vehicles, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options, an employee stock purchase program, and other financial, health, and well-being focused benefits.', 'Because we take a balanced, global approach to our benefits, benefit offerings may vary by location, position, and/or business unit. Some benefits are company-paid, while others are available through team member contributions. For details visit', 'https://www.virtualfairhub.com/amerisourcebergen', '.', 'Schedule', 'Full time', 'Salary Range*', '$93,500 - 143,990', 'This Salary Range reflects a National Average for this job. The actual range may vary based on your locale. Ranges in Colorado/California/Washington State-specific locations may be up to 10% lower than the minimum salary range, and 12% higher than the maximum salary range.', 'Affiliated Companies:', 'Affiliated Companies: Lash Group, LLC', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'AmerisourceBergen is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or membership in any other class protected by federal, state or local law.', 'The company’s continued success depends on the full and effective utilization of qualified individuals. Therefore, harassment is prohibited and all matters related to recruiting, training, compensation, benefits, promotions and transfers comply with equal opportunity principles and are non-discriminatory.', 'AmerisourceBergen is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities during the employment process which are consistent with legal requirements. If you wish to request an accommodation while seeking employment, please call 888.692.2272 or email', 'hrsc@amerisourcebergen.com', '. We will make accommodation determinations on a request-by-request basis. Messages and emails regarding anything other than accommodations requests will not be returned']

job_qualification: ['AutoCAD', 'Google Suite', 'Enterprise software', 'ERP systems', 'English', 'MRP', "Bachelor's degree", 'Organizational skills', 'SolidWorks', 'Electrical Engineering', '2 years']
job_description: ['Are you often perceived as being impatient, even though you’ve actually thought out your actions? Do you prefer the wide open landscape of working on projects rather than the day-to-day chore of repetitive tasks? Are you comfortable with taking calculated risks? Are you self-sufficient and dislike delegation because no one could do the way you want it to be done anyway? Are you process oriented with a knack for setting up systems which are able to effectively guide people and the course of action selected? Do you enjoy making personal contributions to solutions and goals that are larger than yourself?', '', '', 'If this sounds like you, then we need to talk…', '', '', 'Frazer, a leading builder of emergency medical vehicles, is currently seeking a', 'Electrical Engineer', 'to join our team. The', 'Electrical Engineer', 'at Frazer reports to the', 'Engineering Manager', ', and is responsible for providing technical leadership to the engineering team. This position is responsible for electrical engineering standards and methods, electrical vehicle subject matter expertise, design improvements, root cause determinations, and project planning with a focus on work breakdown structures and resource estimation. This position will serve as the subject matter expert in implementing electrical vehicle technologies into the Frazer product portfolio. This position will support engineering projects and initiatives, assist in specification development, and provide technical support to the certification program.', '', '', 'What Does a Week in the Life of the Electrical Engineer Look Like?', '', 'Design, develop, and test electrical equipment, components, circuits, or systems.', 'Perform extensive testing and validation of designs to ensure reliability, performance, and safety standards are achieved.', 'Conduct research and studies new technologies to innovate and design solutions or products.', 'Serve as project engineer for electrical vehicle development, integration, and testing initiatives.', 'Coordinate with vendors, suppliers, and other third parties.', 'Apply mathematical and engineering principles and methods to design.', 'Advise electrical system integration across vehicle platforms and products.', 'Advise equipment installation sequencing within a production environment.', 'Advise disposition of new and non-conforming equipment items.', 'Complete work assignments promptly.', 'Document and maintain drawings, specifications, instructions, procedures, and guidelines.', 'Perform other related duties and responsibilities as required.', 'Essential duties listed above are performed while encouraging a Safety First atmosphere and supporting safety initiatives at our Facility.', '', '', 'Secondary Duties:', '', 'Participate in engineering staff meetings', '', 'Required Education and Experience:', '', 'Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering', 'Design and Size Battery Banks, Battery Thermal Management Systems (BTMS), and Electronics Cooling Packages (ECP) for electric vehicle products.', 'Determine design alternatives and improve for cost, durability, performance, and manufacturability goals.', 'Experience working with engineering professionals – engineers, technicians, drafters.', 'Ability to collaborate with other engineering disciplines – mechanical, structural, automotive, and certification.', 'Ability to work in a process driven environment – quality, supply chain, production, and engineering.', 'Experience managing single and multi-phase projects.', 'Experience in the following engineering practices: estimation (time & cost), design and configuration development, bill of material development, manufacturing sequence development, electrical design, sustainment and maintenance, and test and evaluation.', 'Experience working with ERP and MRP enterprise systems.', 'Experience creating, using, modifying, archiving technical documentation.', '2-4 years related experience', '', '', 'Preferred Education and Experience:', '', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical degree with 5+ years of experience showing progressing increases in technical responsibility.', 'Electrical Vehicle design and/or assembly certifications.', 'Knowledge of HV & LV electrical components.', 'AutoCAD and Solidworks or Inventor skills', 'Conceptual knowledge of custom vehicle production experience', '', '', "What's it like to be a part of the Frazer Family?", '', "Frazer is a fast-paced company that is creating some of the most innovative vehicles in the world. You'll find a unique team of individuals who continue to push the boundaries of what is possible in the Healthcare and EMS space. A diverse team, a great culture, and a positive work environment are just some of the things that make working at Frazer so rewarding.", '', '', 'What Kind of Employees Thrive at Frazer?', '', 'Frazer is a company with a diverse group of employees from all over the world. Frazer welcomes employees with all types of backgrounds, cultural and socio-economic backgrounds. If you are hard working, honest and drug-free, you will love working at Frazer.', '', '', 'Safety & Drug Policy', '', "Employee health and safety is a priority here at Frazer. We're committed to providing a safe, secure and productive environment for our Frazer family.", '', '', 'To help with this, we perform thorough background checks during the hiring process for all candidates. Convictions will not disqualify you from employment at Frazer, but failure to tell us about it up front will. Also, Frazer has a zero tolerance drug use policy and you must pass a pre-employment drug screen. If you can’t pass it, we’re not the place for you.', '', '', 'A True Culture', '', 'Frazer is a company that relies on its core values and the drive of its people. With a focus on longevity and employee success, Frazer welcomes its employees to push the envelope and drive improvement across all aspects of the company. At Frazer, you can unleash your potential!', '', '', 'Employee Driven Benefits', '', "At Frazer, we take pride in listening to what our employees want in benefits. We've come up with a unique set of employee benefits and designed them around our culture.", '', '', 'Weekly paycheck, so you can shop every Friday!', 'Health Care Insurance', 'Dental Benefit options', '401k plan with a company match!', 'Disability Insurance', 'Paid Time Off that begins accruing your first day of employment', 'Eight paid company holidays and ability to take time off during company shut down from Christmas to New Year’s Day!', 'The “Company Kitchen” on site for lunch and snack choices', 'Flexible Work Schedules', 'Professional development and skills training', 'Free Life Skills Training such as financial wellness classes', '', '', 'How Performance is Evaluated', '', 'Communication and collaboration are key at Frazer and we encourage an environment filled with positive feedback and constructive criticism, to unleash your potential for real professional growth! We use things like self-evaluations, group reviews, and quarterly check-ins to help define a clear path to success. You will also have an opportunity to give feedback to peers to help them to grow in their roles as well.', '', '', 'Skills (to Pay the Bills)', '', "Here's a list of a few competencies that the", 'Electrical Engineer', 'at Frazer should have…', '', '', 'Demonstrates independent judgment and well-developed emotional intelligence.', 'Possesses strong organizational skills; able to prioritize tasks.', 'Ability to develop productive working relationships with personnel at all levels of the organization.', 'Handles confidential information appropriately; uses tact and diplomacy.', 'Demonstrates excellent attention to detail and a customer-service mindset.', 'Possesses proactive problem-solving skills; suggests solutions.', 'Is committed to superior performance; meets deadlines.', 'Handles pressure and works well in a fast-paced environment.', 'Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, where change happens often and without prior notice.', 'A self-disciplined person with precise accuracy for details.', 'Ethical and trustworthy conduct and adherence to policies and procedures.', '', '', 'Software Knowledge', '', 'Also, here are a few software packages that the', 'Electrical Engineer', 'would eventually need to be versed in. Don’t worry . . . we expect some on-the-job training.', '', '', 'Google G-Suite (Gmail, Documents, Drive, Spreadsheets, etc.)', 'UKG (HRIS)', 'ERP and MRP enterprise systems', '', '', 'Oh, and $alary', '', "Of course, we didn't forget salary… Frazer offers competitive pay and this role will start with a salary between", '$85,000-$100,000 annually', 'depending on education, certifications, and experience.', '', '', 'Work Schedule', '', 'The', 'Electrical Engineer', 'will work', 'Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM-3:30 PM', '. Late afternoon/evening/weekend hours may be required as needed. Work schedules may change to accommodate production needs.', '', '', 'Application Process', '', 'If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, visit our website to complete the following steps:', '', 'Online application', 'Resume and optional cover letter', 'Culture Index Survey - as part of our process, please take this short survey (5-12 minutes to complete) on a computer, tablet, or laptop NOT a smart phone. It does not always function properly on smart phones and is difficult to see. Also, please take the survey in your native/first language (there are multiple choices besides English in the drop down menu if needed).', '', 'Culture Index Survey Link', '', 'Thanks again for your interest in Frazer. Should your skills and qualifications meet those of the position, we will contact you further. Please check your email for further application status updates.', '', 'We look forward to hearing from you!']
